perturbation.original_text: 2.1 Subject to the terms of this Agreement (including, without limitation, Sections 2.3, 2.4, 2.6 and 5 below), PFHOF hereby grants to the Village Media Company a worldwide, non-exclusive, limited, non-sublicenseable and non-assignable (except to the extent set forth in this Agreement) right and license to (a) Exploit the PFHOF Works and (b) edit, supplement or otherwise adapt, incorporate or otherwise utilize, the PFHOF Works to create, produce and Exploit new, original work(s) (each such work in this clause (b), a "HOFV Work"). For the avoidance of doubt, after the termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Village Media Company and its permitted licensees shall continue to have the right to fully exploit, use, and Exploit the HOFV Works for the length of the term of the license granted by PFHOF in connection with such HOFV Work pursuant to Section 2.3; provided that the length of the term of such license shall be a minimum of five (5) years.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 Subject to the terms of this Agreement (including, without limitation, Sections 2.3, 2.4, 2.6 and 5 below), PFHOF hereby grants to the Village Media Company a worldwide, non-exclusive, limited, non-sublicenseable and non-assignable (except to the extent set forth in this Agreement) right and license to (a) Exploit the PFHOF Works and (b) edit, supplement or otherwise adapt, incorporate or otherwise utilize, the PFHOF Works to create, produce and Exploit new, original work(s) (each such work in this clause (b), a "HOFV Work"). For the avoidance of doubt, after the termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Village Media Company and its permitted assignees shall continue to have the right to fully exploit, use, and Exploit the HOFV Works for the length of the term of the license granted by PFHOF in connection with such HOFV Work pursuant to Section 2.3; provided that the length of the term of such authorization shall be a minimum of one (1) year.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states "permitted licensees," but the modified text changes "permitted licensees" to "permitted assignees" and changes 'license' to 'authorization'. The original text states that the length of the license shall be a minimum of five (5) years, and is contradicted by changing it to one (1) year. This creates ambiguity in the definition of licensees/assignees and the length of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1 Subject to Section 2.6, the Village Media Company shall, or shall cause HOFV to, pay to PFHOF a minimum guarantee of one million two hundred and fifty thousand dollars ($1,250,000) (the "Annual Guarantee") each year during the Term; provided that the Parties acknowledge and agree that after the first five (5) years of the Term, the Annual Guarantee shall increase by three percent (3%) on a year-over-year basis (e.g., the Annual Guarantee shall increase to $1,287,500 for year six (6) and to $1,326,125 for year seven (7)). The first Annual Guarantee payment shall be due and payable on the Effective Date and thereafter shall be payable to PFHOF on each twelve (12) month anniversary of the Closing Date during the Term.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 Subject to Section 2.6, the Village Media Company shall, or shall cause HOFV to, pay to PFHOF a minimum payment of one million two hundred and fifty thousand dollars ($1,250,000) (the "Annual Payment") each year during the Term; provided that the Parties acknowledge and agree that after the first five (5) years of the Term, the Annual Payment may increase by three percent (3%) on a year-over-year basis (e.g., the Annual Payment may increase to $1,287,500 for year six (6) and to $1,326,125 for year seven (7)). The first Annual Payment payment shall be due and payable on the Effective Date and thereafter shall be payable to PFHOF on each eighteen (18) month anniversary of the Closing Date during the Term.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text changes "Annual Guarantee" to "Annual Payment," making it unclear whether these terms are interchangeable. Further, replacing 'shall' to 'may' introduces uncertainty. The original text indicates that the payment shall be payable to PFHOF on each twelve (12) month anniversary of the Closing Date during the Term, and is contradicted by changing it to eighteen (18) months. This creates ambiguity in the agreed payment schedule.

perturbation.original_text: 7.3 Compliance with Laws and Regulations. Each of the Village Media Company and PFHOF, as applicable, agrees to be in material compliance with all federal, state, and local laws, ordinances, and regulations applicable to its respective operations and to obtain and maintain all licenses and permits required by law necessary for each of their respective operations.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.3 Adherence to Legislation and Rules. Each of the Village Media Company and PFHOF, as applicable, agrees to be in partial compliance with all federal, state, and local statutes, ordinances, and regulatory requirements applicable to its respective operations and to attempt to obtain and maintain all licenses and authorizations recommended by legislation necessary for each of their respective operations.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text changes "Compliance with Laws and Regulations" to "Adherence to Legislation and Rules," making it unclear whether these terms are interchangeable. By changing 'material compliance' to 'partial compliance' introduces uncertainty and ambiguity. By replacing 'agrees to' with 'attempt to' introduces uncertainty. The original text states that licenses and permits are required by law, which is contradicted by changing it to licenses and authorizations recommended by legislation.
